result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
9:06 AM Defendant Octavius K. L. J. L. Buckley in court.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 22CF175, 22TR956, 22TR957 & 22TR958. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and requests reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  Defendant requests an attorney. Court questions defendant re: employment. Statement by defendant. Off the record at 9:09 AM.

On the Record at 9:49 AM Defendant Octavius K. L. J. L. Buckley in court.  Attorney Scott Nelson in court for the defendant. Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Nelson states the defendant qualifies for the public defender. ADA McElroy makes bond recommendation. Atty Nelson makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500 signature bond and conditions of: Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives the time limits. Court will set for Status of Counsel on November 22, 2022 at 10:00 AM. Mandatory Appearance.

Court adjourned at 9:52 AM.

Court enters Not Guilty pleas on all the traffic cases.

parties.name: Buckley, Octavius K. L. J. L.

records.addlTxt: I called the defendant and informed him his request to appear by zoom was denied by the Court. Defendant was told he would have to be here in person. Defendant was concerned he wouldn't be able to find a ride but stated he would try.

records.addlTxt: Def called worried he missed his court date on October 18, 2022. Def was told his court date was scheduled for October 25, 2022. Def requested to appear by zoom and I told him to put something in writing. Def was given our fax number.
